column4: I would like some help to complete the process of copying and pasting from a mounted HD (not part of ubuntu) to a folder (var/ftp/BlenderArt) in the ubuntu file system. right now i can't because of file permissions I believe which I don't fully understand
ok, are there folders and stuff? or just plain files in the one folder?
ok, there are two things to check.. you have to be able to read the files off the external hd.. that usually isn't a problem
next, you need permission to write in /var/ftp.. which I think you might not have
that's what i think also
terminal or gui? how do you want to do this
terminal
then it would be something like this.. "sudo cp /media/disk/mystuff/* /var/ftp/"
the /media/disk/mystuff part is just a guess.. you'll have to change it to the path of the files you want to copy
this will just copy the files.. so we don't lose them if something bad happens
ok i give it a go
lots and lots of files?
will you help me in another tab....scrolling up is a hassle
sure
you mean when you're using sudo?
when using sudo you use your regular user password.. the one you log in with
ubuntu doesn't use the root account like that.. other distros do that
if you need a root terminal you can use sudo -i
makes perfect sense to me now
but remember to type "exit" when you're done.. a root terminal is like a sharp sharp knife =)

thanks I will remember that... i was trying to log-in to the FTP server and view directory files and it asks for a password  when I type in dir....don't have a clue what the password is since it's not my user to ubuntu password...thought i would try logging in as root user ...that didnt work as well
some ftp servers use "virtual users".. ie the userlist for the ftp server isn't the same as the host machine.. other ftp servers use the same users..
